title: Arsenal rebel against Walcott’s captaincy
text:
FA Cup Extra Time: Arsenal players don’t follow Walcott’s sleeves, the real star of Sutton v Gunners  33am   HOW Arsenal rebelled against Theo Walcott’s captaincy, and the real star of the FA Cup clash. 
Arsenal and Sutton’s fifth round clash is wrapped up in FA Cup Extra Time! 
ARSENAL REBEL AGAINST WALCOTT CAPTAINCY 
Less than two weeks ago, Theo Walcott was caught breaking an Arsenal tradition against Hull by not wearing the same length sleeves as his captain and the rest of the Gunners players. 
However, for the 2-0 win over Sutton in the FA Cup fifth round , the Englishman was handed the captain’s armband, so theoretically whatever type of sleeves he decided to wear (in collaboration with the kitman) was what all the Arsenal players should’ve worn - but that wasn’t the case. 
Walcott once again sported short sleeves, but none of the other Gunners players followed his lead. 
To make matters worse for the attacker, he didn’t have a Arsenal club pennant (banner) to exchange with Sutton captain James Collins before the match. 
That left the non-league skipper looking offended. Sutton United v Arsenal… UNDERWAY COME ON YOU GUNNERS! 🔴 — Arsenal FC (@Arsenal) February 20, 2017 
Considering all that, the actual match went well for Walcott. 
After missing out on the chance to score his 100th Arsenal goal when he failed to connect with Lucas Perez’s shot (that ended up in Sutton’s goal), he made amends by doubling the lead in the 55th minute. 👏👏👏 Massive congratulations to @theowalcott - the 18th player in our history to reach 💯 Arsenal goals ⚽ #Theo100 pic.twitter.com/fTdwbSmHPP — Arsenal FC (@Arsenal) February 20, 2017 
THE REAL STAR OF SUTTON v ARSENAL 
Sutton’s 46-year-old reserve goalkeeper didn’t get on the pitch against Arsenal, but that didn’t stop him stealing the show. 
Wayne Shaw has become an internet sensation since his non-league side drew the Gunners in the FA Cup fifth round, and today he took it to another level. 
Before the match he was pictured hoovering the dugout, at half-time he was in the bar, and in the 83rd minute he was captured on camera eating a pie. 
Before the match, former Newcastle striker Alan Shearer recalled a time when they were young teammates at Southampton. 
“He did (play in the same team as me), absolutely. When we were 14 or 15,” said Shearer 
“I actually followed my dreams to the Premier League, and he followed his to the burger van, I think.” Hoovers dugout before the game, in the bar at halftime, pie in the last 10 minutes. The real star of Arsenal v Sutton? pic.twitter.com/rQcxXB8gMK — FOX SPORTS Football (@FOXFOOTBALL) February 20, 2017 
SUTTON IMPRESSED WENGER 
105 places separate Sutton and Arsenal in England’s football pyramid, with the non-league side currently 17th in the fifth-tier National League, but that didn’t stop Arsene Wenger being impressed. 
“We did the job,” he told BBC Sport. 
“It was not an easy game at all. We have to give them credit because every error we made they took advantage of on this pitch. They played very well.” Arsenal's French manager Arsene Wenger, second left, sits with his substitutes. Source: AP 
SANCHEZ WILL BE WISHING HE FOLLOWED OZIL’S LEAD 
Alexis Sanchez will probably be thinking he should’ve followed Mesut Ozil’s lead and missed the game against Sutton. 
The Chilean was reportedly on a break after the 5-1 Champions League thumping by Bayern Munich, but was a substitute for the FA Cup clash. 
After 73 minutes, Sanchez was brought into the game. Within minutes there were audible chants from Arsenal fans saying: “Give it to Sanchez”. 
However, the Sutton fans chanted: “Who are ya?”. Though they obviously knew who he was because after the match Sanchez was mobbed by excited fans on the pitch. Spectators embrace Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez. Source: AP 
Ozil avoided all of that commotion. 
The superstar missed the clash with Sutton and posted a snapchat of him travelling on a plane ahead of a reported break. 
But he still attempted to keep Arsenal supporters’ worries of a potential transfer at bay by uploading to Instagram the below picture. Looks like Mesut Ozil is out of Sutton v ArsenalOzil has posted a picture from a plane.Rumoured to have been given 2 weeks off. pic.twitter.com/n6STsuFjlY
